rule1.rule: Check that good proximity between content is maintained.
rule1.description: Proximity issues can arise when interface elements are designed far apart from one another. This mostly affects people with low-vision who rely on zoom software.

rule2.rule: Make sure color isn't the only way information is conveyed.
rule2.description: Can you still see where links are among body content if everything is grayscale?

rule3.rule: Make sure instructions are not visual or audio-only.
rule3.description: Use a combination of characteristics to write cues, particularly the actual names of sections and elements, rather than just descriptions like location (“on the right”) or audio (“after the tone”).

rule4.rule: Use a simple, straightforward, and consistent layout.
rule4.description: A complicated layout can be confusing to understand and use.
